conclusion: Inside the box there are four fixed, slanted baffles.
The black baffle sits highest and slopes downwards toward the left side of the box.
The purple baffle is a little lower and slopes downwards toward the right.
A yellow baffle low on the left and a cyan baffle low on the right complete the course.
The three inlets A, B, C are arranged left-to-right along the top.
At the bottom are three separate catch-pockets D (left), E (centre), F (right).
Stream A lands on the upper black baffle, is carried down-and-left, clears the yellow baffle and drops straight into the left-hand pocket D.

Stream B just misses the black baffle, hits the upper end of the purple baffle, is pushed down-and-right, then the cyan baffle guides it a little farther right so it falls into the right-hand pocket F.
Stream C falls near the right wall, catches the lower end of the purple baffle, is sent down-and-left, then passes the yellow baffle and drops into the centre pocket E.
Final prediction: A flows into D, B flows into F, C flows into E.
